name: QueryResults
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
QueryResults
description:
QueryResults is a special case Array with additional values. A QueryResults object is returned from Dataset#run and contains the Entities from the query as well as the queryâ€™s cursor and more_results value.

Please be cautious when treating the QueryResults as an Array. Many common Array methods will return a new Array instance.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query("Task")
tasks = datastore.run query

tasks.size #=> 3
tasks.cursor.to_s #=> "c2Vjb25kLXBhZ2UtY3Vyc29y"

examples.caption: Caution, many Array methods will return a new Array instance:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query("Task")
tasks = datastore.run query

tasks.size #=> 3
tasks.cursor.to_s #=> "c2Vjb25kLXBhZ2UtY3Vyc29y"
descriptions = tasks.map { |task| task["description"] }
descriptions.size #=> 3
descriptions.cursor #=> raise NoMethodError

methods.name: more_results
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
QueryResults#more_results
methods.description:
The state of the query after the current batch.

Expected values are:

  • :NOT_FINISHED
  • :MORE_RESULTS_AFTER_LIMIT
  • :MORE_RESULTS_AFTER_CURSOR
  • :NO_MORE_RESULTS

methods.name: not_finished?
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
QueryResults#not_finished?
methods.description: Convenience method for determining if the more_results value is :NOT_FINISHED

methods.name: more_after_limit?
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
QueryResults#more_after_limit?
methods.description: Convenience method for determining if the more_results value is :MORE_RESULTS_AFTER_LIMIT

methods.name: more_after_cursor?
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
QueryResults#more_after_cursor?
methods.description: Convenience method for determining if the more_results value is :MORE_RESULTS_AFTER_CURSOR

methods.name: no_more?
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
QueryResults#no_more?
methods.description: Convenience method for determining if the more_results value is :NO_MORE_RESULTS

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query "Task"
tasks = datastore.run query

if tasks.next?
  next_tasks = tasks.next
end

require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query "Task"
tasks = datastore.run query

if tasks.next?
  next_tasks = tasks.next
end

require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query "Task"
tasks = datastore.run query

first_task = tasks.first
first_cursor = tasks.cursor_for first_task

params.name: result
params.description: The entity object to get a cursor for.

methods.name: each_with_cursor
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
QueryResults#each_with_cursor
methods.description:
Calls the given block once for each result and cursor combination, which are passed as parameters.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query "Task"
tasks = datastore.run query
tasks.each_with_cursor do |task, cursor|
  puts "Task #{task.key.id} (#cursor)"
end

params.name: yield
params.description:
The block for accessing each query result
and cursor.

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
QueryResults#all
methods.description:
Retrieves all query results by repeatedly loading #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each query result, which is passed as the parameter.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method may make several API calls until all query results are retrieved. Be sure to use as narrow a search criteria as possible. Please use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each query result by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query "Task"
tasks = datastore.run query
tasks.all do |task|
  puts "Task #{task.key.id} (#cursor)"
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query "Task"
tasks = datastore.run query
tasks.all.map(&:key).each do |key|
  puts "Key #{key.id}"
end

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query "Task"
tasks = datastore.run query
tasks.all(request_limit: 10) do |task|
  puts "Task #{task.key.id} (#cursor)"
end

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to
make to load all query results. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each query result.

methods.name: all_with_cursor
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
QueryResults#all_with_cursor
methods.description:
Retrieves all query results and cursors by repeatedly loading #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each result and cursor combination, which are passed as parameters.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method may make several API calls until all query results are retrieved. Be sure to use as narrow a search criteria as possible. Please use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating all results and cursors by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query "Task"
tasks = datastore.run query
tasks.all_with_cursor do |task, cursor|
  puts "Task #{task.key.id} (#cursor)"
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query "Task"
tasks = datastore.run query
tasks.all_with_cursor.count # number of result/cursor pairs

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query "Task"
tasks = datastore.run query
tasks.all_with_cursor(request_limit: 10) do |task, cursor|
  puts "Task #{task.key.id} (#cursor)"
end

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to
make to load all tables. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description:
The block for accessing each query result
and cursor.
